name: Bun Cha Hang Quat
specialty: Bun Cha (grilled pork with rice noodles)
description: Hidden alley stall frequented by locals. Family-run operation with lightning speed service. Assembly line cooking with fermented rice noodles, fresh herbs, grilled pork belly & meatballs, crispy crab spring rolls. Lunch only, closes at 2pm.
mustTryDishes: Bun Cha with grilled pork belly

name: Bún Chả Hương Liên
address: 24 Lê Văn Hưu, Hai Bà Trưng, Hanoi
description: Famous 'Bun Cha Obama' restaurant where Anthony Bourdain hosted former US President Obama for Parts Unknown. Traditional grilled pork with rice noodles in aromatic broth.

name: Phở Gia Truyền Bát Đàn
description: Considered the best pho in Hanoi with perfect balance of richness and delicacy. Starts selling at 6am and sells out quickly. Only serves pho tai (medium rare beef) and pho chin (well-cooked beef). Light yet flavorful broth best enjoyed with banh quay (fried breadsticks).

name: Pho 10 Ly Quoc Su
description: Part of a stellar trio of Pho 10 branches in Hanoi. Famous pho spot serving soup with brisket, filet, and beef flank. Comes with fried dough sticks. Beware of imitations around the city.

name: Bánh Cuốn Bà Hoành
description: Michelin Bib Gourmand 2024. Street food eatery serving delectable bánh cuốn - Vietnamese steamed rolls with minced pork and black fungus. Traditional preparation methods passed down through generations.

name: Gia
description: One Michelin Star restaurant (retained 2024). Elegant contemporary Vietnamese cuisine with refined techniques and local ingredients. Sophisticated dining experience showcasing Vietnam's culinary heritage.

name: Hibana by Koki
description: One Michelin Star restaurant (retained 2024). Authentic Japanese cuisine with meticulous attention to detail. Features high-quality ingredients and traditional Japanese cooking techniques.

name: Tầm Vị
description: One Michelin Star restaurant (retained 2024). Elevated Vietnamese cuisine with modern presentation and traditional flavors. Focus on local ingredients and seasonal menus.

name: Pizza 4P's
description: Highly recommended by travelers with locations in both Hanoi and Ho Chi Minh City. Known for exceptional pizza with burrata on top and unique Japanese-Italian fusion approach.

name: Xôi Yến
description: Makes the best xoi xeo (sticky rice with mung beans and fried shallots) in Hanoi. Called the best sticky rice by expats living in Vietnam. Traditional family recipe.

name: Ănăn Saigon
description: One Michelin Star restaurant (retained 2024). Contemporary Vietnamese cuisine with creative presentations. Uses traditional techniques with modern flair and local ingredients.

name: CieL
description: One Michelin Star restaurant (new 2024). Features innovative cuisine with meticulous technique. Contemporary cooking with global influences and Vietnamese elements.

name: Coco Dining
description: One Michelin Star restaurant (promoted 2024). Contemporary Vietnamese cuisine with modern techniques. Focus on Vietnamese flavors presented with contemporary flair.

name: Long Trieu
description: One Michelin Star restaurant. Sophisticated Vietnamese cuisine with attention to presentation and flavor balance. Elegant dining environment.

name: Akuna
description: One Michelin Star restaurant (new 2024). Creative European dishes with Vietnamese influences, plus optional wine pairing. Innovative fusion approach.

name: Pho Le
description: Recommended by tour guides and homestay owners as the best pho not just in Saigon but in all of Vietnam. Southern Vietnamese style with sweeter broth than northern counterparts.

name: Bé Ni 2
description: Michelin Bib Gourmand 2024. A 24/7 bustling, casual spot offering rice dishes during the day and seafood at night. Most shellfish sourced locally for top-notch quality.

name: Madame Lam
description: Michelin selected restaurant serving authentic Vietnamese home-style cooking. Traditional family recipes and warm hospitality in cozy setting.

name: Bun Rieu Ganh
description: Family-run restaurant specializing in crab paste noodle soup with tofu, pork sausage, bean sprouts, served with shrimp paste/tamarind sauce. Cooked in massive cauldron with bold seafood flavors.

name: Banh Mi Huynh Hoa
address: 26 Lê Thị Riêng, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City
description: Popular with locals, serves the largest and most loaded banh mi with thick layer of paté and sweet pork floss. Known for generous portions and authentic flavors.

name: The Lunch Lady (Nguyễn Thị Thành)
description: Famous street food vendor mentioned in Bourdain's guide. Daily rotating menu of authentic Vietnamese dishes. Street-side dining experience.

name: Banh Mi Phuong
description: Anthony Bourdain's favorite banh mi spot and considered the best according to travel itineraries. Famous for authentic flavors and traditional preparation methods.

name: Hai Chiến Cao Lầu
description: Traditional Hoi An noodle dish specialist mentioned in Bourdain's guide. Cao lau is a unique Hoi An specialty that can only be made with local water and ingredients.

name: Long Com Ga
description: Authentic Com Ga restaurant serving chicken and rice dish with offal and congealed blood. Traditional Hoi An preparation methods.

name: La Maison 1888
description: One Michelin Star restaurant (new 2024). Serves 5- or 7-course set menu featuring top-notch ingredients from Vietnam, France and Japan. Elegant fusion dining.

name: Nén Danang
description: First restaurant in Vietnam to receive Michelin Green Star (2024). Focus on sustainability, local sourcing, and environmentally conscious dining practices.

name: Mỳ Quảng Cô Sáu
description: Michelin Bib Gourmand restaurant offering authentic 'mi quảng' noodles with intense turmeric broth and toppings like chicken, fish, and shrimp. Also serves 'thịt heo bánh tráng' - thinly sliced pork belly rolled in rice paper with herbs and veggies.
